components/locale/Selector.Bottom Right: You can change the language at any time in the bottom right corner of the page. ↘️

components/modal/Error.Common Steps: Some common troubleshooting steps that might be helpful:
components/modal/Error.Connection Explanation: this site requires connection to the internet for most functionality.
components/modal/Error.Desktop: Visit this site on a desktop computer
components/modal/Error.Desktop Explanation: this site works best on desktop web browsers.
components/modal/Error.File a Bug: filing a bug in the PACTA repository
components/modal/Error.Heading: An error occurred
components/modal/Error.If Persists: If this issue persists, please report this issue by
components/modal/Error.Refresh Explanation: most of our pages save your progress as you go, so it's almost always fine to reload the page.
components/modal/Error.Subheading: Sorry about that, our team take bug reports seriously, and will try to make it right!

components/modal/FakeUsers.Description: Microsoft Active Directory doesn't allow us to programatically log in as other users, so you will need to manually log in as one of the users below. These are only in the Local environment (for now).
components/modal/FakeUsers.Heading: Fake Users
components/modal/FakeUsers.Subheading: Quickly switch between profiles for testing.

components/modal/PermissionDenied.Email Us: If you think this is a bug (something that you should have access to), or if you want to let us know how you got here, please email us at
components/modal/PermissionDenied.Heading: Permission Denied
components/modal/PermissionDenied.How You Got Here: It is likely that you have gotten here either by entering in an invalid URL, or by clicking on a link or button that is not set up correctly.
components/modal/PermissionDenied.Subheading: You aren't authorized to view this page

initiative/invitations.Heading: Initaitive Invitations
initiative/invitations.New Invitations Help: Create new invitations by clicking the button below. You can create as many invitations as you want, but each invitation can only be used once. Invitation codes must only contain alphanumeric characters (a-z, A-Z, 0-9), underscores and dashes. You can create multiple invitations at once by separating them with tabs, commas, newlines, or spaces.
initiative/invitations.No Invitations: This initiative does not require an invitation to join - anyone who finds this initiative can join it.
initiative/invitations.Yes Invitations: This initiative requires an invitation (a unique, one-time code) to join. You can create these invitations below.
initiative/invitations.You can change: You can change this behavior on the

This invitation has already been used.
pages/join.You can learn more about the initiative: You can learn more about the initiative here.
pages/join.You've been invited to join an initiativ: You've been invited to join an initiative
pages/join.do-accept: Do you want to accept this invitation?
pages/join.if-accept: If you accept this invitation, you'll be able to add your portfolios to the project, where they will be included in aggregated analysis. You aren't required to accept this invitation if you just want to run the analysis on your own, but joining the initiative may enable you to access internal benefits, like the ability to see the analysis results from the aggregated portfolios.
pages/join.what-shared: If you accept X, Y, Z will be whared with the initiative administrators, but A, B, C will not be.
